spatial.kdpoint

Class KDPoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • spatial.kdpoint.KDPoint

  • public class KDPoint
extends java.lang.Object

    KDPoint is a class that represents a k-dimensional point in Euclidean space, where k is a positive integer. It provides methods for initialization, copy construction, equality checks and distance calculations. The precision of KDPoints is arbitrary.

    YOU SHOULD ***NOT*** EDIT THIS CLASS! If you do, you risk not passing our tests!

    Author:
    Jason Filippou

    • Field Detail

      • coords

        public int[] coords
        To make matters simple for client code, we will allow the KDPoint's coordinates to be publicly accessible. This makes KDPoints mutable, so deep copies will be required wherever we copy KDPoints.

      • ZERO

        The point (0, 0)

    • Constructor Detail

      • KDPoint

        public KDPoint()
        Default constructor initializes this as a 2D KDPoint describing the Cartesian origin.

      • KDPoint

        public KDPoint(int... vals)
        Initialize a KDPoint with some int values. The dimensionality of the point is implicitly given by the length of the argument vals.
        Parameters:
        vals - The values with which to initialize the KDPoint.* @see System#arraycopy(Object, int, Object, int, int)

      • KDPoint

        public KDPoint(KDPoint p)
        Initialize a KDPoint based on an already existing KDPoint. Since KDPoint is a mutable class, all new KDPoint instances should be created by this copy-constructor!
        Parameters:
        p - The KDPoint on which we will base the creation of this.

    • Method Detail

      • getOriginInDim

        public static KDPoint getOriginInDim(int dim)
                              throws InvalidDimensionalityException
        A static method that returns a KDPoint instance that describes the Cartesian origin corresponding to the dimensionality of the space provided.
        Parameters:
        dim - The dimensionality of the space.
        Returns:
        The origin of the space, with appropriate dimensionality.
        Throws:
        InvalidDimensionalityException - if dim is less than or equal to 0.

      • euclideanDistance

        public double euclideanDistance(KDPoint p)
                         throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Calculate the Euclidean distance between this and p.
        Parameters:
        p - The KDPoint to calculate the distance to.
        Returns:
        The Euclidean distance between the two KDPoints.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the dimensionality of the two KDPoints is different.

      • euclideanDistance

        public static double euclideanDistance(KDPoint p1,
                                       KDPoint p2)
        A static version of distance calculations. Since the Euclidean distance is symmetric, it's somewhat awkward to have to specify a start and end point, as euclideanDistance does, so we provide this option as well.
        Parameters:
        p1 - One of the two KDPoints to calculate the distance of.
        p2 - One of the two KDPoints to calculate the distance of.
        Returns:
        The Euclidean distance between p1 and p2.
